__comment_purpose: File rearrangement allows you to reorganize disk image contents before metadata conversion

rearrange.__comment: Simple rename: Change a single file name
Move to subdirectory: Trailing slash preserves filename
Move and rename: No trailing slash provides explicit destination name
Glob pattern: Move all assembly source files to SRC subdirectory
Glob with subdirectory: Move specific file types from a directory
Absolute path: Use leading slash for full paths including volume name
Recursive glob: Move all binary files from any subdirectory
Complex example: Organize library files into structured directories
Cleanup suffixes: Remove Cadius-added suffixes during rearrangement
Group by type: Organize documentation files

__comment_notes: Pattern matching is case-insensitive for ProDOS compatibility
Destination directories are created automatically if they don't exist
If multiple patterns match the same file, first match wins
Rearrangement happens after extraction, before metadata conversion
Use relative paths for files within the volume root
Use absolute paths (starting with /) to explicitly specify volume name
